{{quote|Even so fall the people of [[Nargothrond]], but for them there shall come no [[Spring]].|Ornil in ''[[The Grey Annals]]''}}

'''Ornil''' was an [[Elves of Nargothrond|Elf of Nargothrond]]<ref>{{WJ|Index}}, entry ''Ornil''</ref> who met with [[Túrin]] after the [[Battle of Tumhalad]].

== History ==
After [[Gwindor]]'s death during the [[Battle of Tumhalad]], Túrin rushed back to [[Nargothrond]], gathering any survivors of the battle in the process, including Ornil. As leaves were falling from trees in a great wind, Ornil compared the changing of the seasons to the [[Fall of Nargothrond]], causing Túrin's pace to hasten.<ref>{{GA|277}}, p. 86</ref> Nothing else is known about Ornil.

== Etymology ==
The name ''Ornil'' is in [[Sindarin]]. While its meaning is not entirely clear, according to ''[[Eldamo]]'' it might contain the element ''[[orn]]'' ("tree").<ref>{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=http://eldamo.org/content/words/word-792785559.html|articlename=S. ''Ornil'' m.|website=Eldamo|accessed=25 March 2022}}</ref>

== See also ==
*[[Orlin]], kinsmen of Túrin through [[Morwen|Mavwin]] according to the early [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''.
